Text:
Mislabeled: 1920x1080p, not 1920x1280...

1280x720p is also common, which is probably where the confusion lies.

(A lot of "cinematic" content is actually delivered letterboxed as a super-wide 1920x800/1920x816 format.  Cropping video to remove letterboxing can significantly improve file-size/compression. 720x400p is common for low-res DVD and BluRay rips.)
thanks i just realized what i did lmao. i dont think i could change it now tho my latest upload will post correct res
